body_html:
You need to add ":0"
print sess.run(y, {'x:0': [1, 2, 3]})

Here's some background on why the ":0" is needed:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/37870634/419116

On Tue, Jul 19, 2016 at 3:06 AM, Danijar Hafner notifications@github.com
wrote:

I couldn't find anything in the documentation
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/how_tos/reading_data/index.html#feeding
on this. Is it possible to feed placeholders by name? If not, why?

import tensorflow as tf
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None,), 'x')
y = tf.reduce_sum(x)
sess = tf.Session()

sess.run(y, {x: [1, 2, 3]}# > 6.0

sess.run(y, {'x': [1, 2, 3]}# > Cannot interpret feed_dict key as Tensor: The name 'x' refers to an operation,# > not a Tensor. Tensor names must be of the form "<op_name>:<output_index>".

—

Here's some background on why the ":0" is needed:

I couldn't find anything in the documentation
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/how_tos/reading_data/index.html#feeding

import tensorflow as tf
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None,), 'x')
y = tf.reduce_sum(x)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(y, {x: [1, 2, 3]}# > 6.0
sess.run(y, {'x': [1, 2, 3]}# > Cannot interpret feed_dict key as Tensor: The name 'x' refers to an operation,# > not a Tensor. Tensor names must be of the form "<op_name>:<output_index>".

body:
You need to add ":0"
print sess.run(y, {'x:0': [1, 2, 3]})

Here's some background on why the ":0" is needed:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/37870634/419116

On Tue, Jul 19, 2016 at 3:06 AM, Danijar Hafner notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I couldn't find anything in the documentation
> https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/how_tos/reading_data/index.html#feeding
> on this. Is it possible to feed placeholders by name? If not, why?
> 
> import tensorflow as tf
> x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None,), 'x')
> y = tf.reduce_sum(x)
> sess = tf.Session()
> 
> sess.run(y, {x: [1, 2, 3]}# > 6.0
> 
> sess.run(y, {'x': [1, 2, 3]}# > Cannot interpret feed_dict key as Tensor: The name 'x' refers to an operation,# > not a Tensor. Tensor names must be of the form "<op_name>:<output_index>".
>
